Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: raeofbonnybanks
Reviews.Content: First of all we could not find it as we had booked Eden Hotel! First room was overlooking a really busy road and the carpet was very grubby and the room itself basic. We asked for a move and the second one was a bit quieter but tiny. As it was late we decided to go back and spend the night in the first one with the windows closed. The beds were comfortable and clean enough as was the bathroom and towels, but the whole room and the corridors are in dire need of refurbishment and deep cleaning. Breakfast was just OK - self service continental but it seemed that people kept coming and going standing about drinking the coffee which is advertised as being complimentary. We stayed only one night and moved to another hotel the next day. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hampshire Hotel - Theatre District Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in one of the best locations in Amsterdam however a little bit expensive for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “not good at all”
Reviews.Author: richardthurston
Reviews.Content: we arrived at Amsterdam at 10''and set of to find the Eden hotel that we had booked and for the next 2 hrs no one had herd of it ' until i asked a taxi driver 5th one he informed us the hotel had changed its name '!!!! nobody had informed us)when we got to the reception we were met by a grumpy man who did not care we had not been informed it had changed its name.great start 'then in to the tiny lift to the attic and what a surprise the room was crap and the carpet was disgusting would not put my dog in its all round hotel very poor 'Amsterdam lovely city won't go to that hotel again .and can't believe it changed its name and did not tell the paying customer !!!!!!!!!!!!o and when you leave they charge you 15 euro citytax extra !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: perryScotland
Reviews.Content: We were a bit wary after reading some previous comments. There was a funny smell when we first entered the room, but I think it was cos they had been trying to clean the carpets. Ours was ok. We got clean towels every day. We stayed 3 nights and the staff were most helpful. Breakfast is 15 euros, but book it at reception, the day before and you get 2 euros 50 off. I would go back to this hotel again as it central and you can walk to Dam Square in about 15 mins or so.

Reviews.Title: “Good but unremarkable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 4sure86
Reviews.Content: Small but clean and adequate room, very polite staff. The hotel is close to most of the major attractions that are outside of the immediate centre including Vondelpark, a major square with lots of bars and restaurants (called Leidseplein) and museums. It is also close to trams. I didn't experience any problems here and it was priced fairly.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but improvements needed to bring it back to life”
Reviews.Author: princesslana
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed here for 3 nights. Location is great, 2 minute walk to Leidseplein square and approx 10 - 15 minutesâ€™ walk to Dam square. The room, though, was TINY! Possibly the smallest room I have ever stayed in. The bathroom was equally as tiny, and in fact wasn't a bathroom as there was no bath, only a shower. It might have been ok for a single person but not for 2 people. The carpet in the room was also filthy. I was afraid to step on it in bare feet. This, I feel, is something that could be easily rectified but shows poor care from management. I didnâ€™t find the reception staff overly friendly either. The positives were the great location and a comfy bed, but unfortunately for me, the negatives outweighed these so I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rob19822891
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for the price paid. Rooms in all AMST hotels are small and this was no exception, but it was spotless, quiet, fresh and bigger than some i have stayed in. Location wise it is excellent. Great transport links via Tram & Bus (direct route to Central station) with stations just across the road. Leidsplein with all its bars and restaurants is literally a 4 minute walk, Dam Square & RLD approx' 20 minutes at a moderate pace. Amsterdam Casino is almost directly opposite. The free hot drinks located near to the reception are a nice touch and we appreciated it. I would defiantly return to this hotel and recommend to others looking for a good value, modern, clean hotel that is close to all the action!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but small uninspiring rooms”
Reviews.Author: JC_Malmo
Reviews.Content: For one night this hotel was ok but the rooms are pokey to say the least. Lumpy pillows. Noise from other rooms and windows. Ok location.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Quaint, Excellent Value, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: surfitz
Reviews.Content: My 8 year old son and I really enjoyed our stay here. We could walk all over Amsterdam from this spot: festive Leidse Square (Leidseplein), the Vondelpark, Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, Bloemenmarkt (flower market), Rembrandt's House, Anne Frank House, lots of cafes and restaurants, and there's a Hop on Hop Off Canal Cruise stop right over the bridge from the hotel. The staff was friendly, there was use of the internet in the small lobby, good coffee, and the tiniest elevator I've ever ridden in. My son thought it was so fun. The hotel has wonderful curb appeal, too. However, beware that there are steep steps up to the lobby, so beware if you have problems with steps. I loved that it felt like a European hotel, not an American one. I can stay in one of those anytime. Amsterdam is one of the quaintest cities in the world. Go if you can!

Reviews.Title: “small room”
Reviews.Author: juliegalloway
Reviews.Content: Room very small, but adequate for needs. Clean and tidy apart from stain on carpet. Breakfast very good. Noise from road during the night, but to be expected as on a main road. Staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok Hotel, but was charged twice!”
Reviews.Author: flyingcupcake
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel and yes the room was small but to be fair the rooms are decribed as being small and when you are in a city like Amsterdam you are not likely to be in the hotel very much! Everything was clean, the free tea and coffee facilities were good, the breakfast was good, the staff were ok but not great. Overall we enjoyed our stay. However, about a week after returning home I got my bank statement and realised that the hotel had charged me twice for our stay. That's the full hotel bill, plus the card commission fee twice. The second charge had immediately taken me into my overdraft. I was angry and annoyed but thought it was a simple mistake that could be put right. I called the hotel and spoke to a member of staff who then proceeded to tell me that they hadn't charged me twice, they had taken one amount of the money on hold upon check in and although they had released it when I paid at check out, it was then up to my bank to release it back into my account. Obviously this was absolute nonsense, of course it was not up to my bank to put that money back into my account, and they couldn't have had the exact sum of our bill when we checked in as breakfast was not included and we chose day by day whether to have it and add it to the bill or not. I tried to explain that my statement clearly showed that the money had come out of my account and was not "on hold" but she was adament so I said I would speak to my bank. They of course said it was a load of rubbish and they had clearly charged me twice and that if they refused to refund me then they would dispute the charge for me. So I called the hotel again, happened to speak to the same member of staff, and when I told her that she was wrong and that they needed to refund me she STILL insisted that the money was on hold and it could take up to a week for my BANK to release it - despite the fact that it had now been two weeks since the charge took place!! Then she got very moody and rude and said that there was no manager for me to speak to and there wouldn't be a manager at the hotel for another 2 days so nothing could be done at the moment. I asked her to leave an urgent message for the manager to contact me as soon as possible. They never did. I decided not to waste any more money making calls to Amsterdam and speaking to idiotic members of staff so I had to dispute it through my bank. And luckily, after about a month, I got the money back. It wouldn't have been so bad if the staff had been apologetic and sympathetic and dealt with their obvious mistake quickly instead of making rubbish excuses like I was stupid enough to believe them and trying to con me out of my money. I won't be staying at another Eden hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the parking!”
Reviews.Author: Merlotcar1
Reviews.Content: Great location means that you can park the car and walk everywhere. Parking facilities for your has to be booked in advance and is pricey â‚¬32.50 euros a day. It is a lock-up garage and parking is tandem style and as such you have to leave your keys at receoption so that the car in front can get out at any time. This is the theory however when we were trying to get to the airport leaving at 7pm reception didn't have the keys nor did they know whose car was blocking us in. Staff at this hour were not solution driven at all and just presented us with the problem. After a frantic 30 minutes the keys miraculously appeared with no explanation but blamed new staff who didn't know the procedures. We stayed in a so called 'superior' room which was standard/small size with stained carpet which was in a dire need of cleaning. Bathrooms again small with a shower curtain that had seen better days. In summary it was a city hotel with a city price and the great location made up for some of the disadvantages

Reviews.Title: “Hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: Viv D
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Amsterdam during our recent vacation. We have a minor billing dispute pending, but found the location, with easy access in and around Leidseplein, excellent, the staff friendly and the wi-fi and coffee were free. Each day in Amsterdam offered an exciting adventure to distract us from our accommodations. Be Alert, our room was small, with a poor layout, no (face) washcloths, the bed was uncomfortable and pillows unfluffable, there weren't any vending machines, for that soda or snack needed in the middle of the night and, no restaurant; very thin walls and carpeting with stains from unknown origins, were the worse part. We asked to be moved but the staff politely told us this was the condition of the other rooms, which in itself is a sad commentary. However, we had an awesome visit and hope to return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complaint”
Reviews.Author: Aby112
Reviews.Content: We stay two nights in this hotel during our recent visit to Amsterdam. The hotel has a good location, near to Leidseplein - lots of pubs & restaurant. From the Central Station, take Tram No.1 or No.2 to Leidseplein stop, from there is approx. 5min walk to the hotel. There's a nearer tram station at the right of the hotel which the tram goes back to Central Station, hence you don't have to walk back to Leidseplein stop with your luggage when you leave. The room is a reasonable size, most hotel rooms in Europe are not big, We find the room size appropriate for it's class. Free WiFi is available in the lobby, however we were able to detect some signal in our room on 3rd Floor. Staffs are friendly and helpful. The hotel provides free coffee and tea in the breakfast counter. We were able to leave our luggage with them after check-out. Well, the bed is not very comfortable and there are stains on the carpet. We did not find the room noisy. We ditched the tram and walked along the track, there are a lot to see and shop. Bloemenmarkt is walking distance away and so is Van Gogh Museum. Do give the All-you-can-eat ribs at Pancake Corner at Leidseplein a try, best value!

Reviews.Title: “First Impressions fade fast”
Reviews.Author: Bob A
Reviews.Content: While looking quite good at the front once in your room you felt like it was the servants quarters Small dirty carpet poor layout uncomfortable bed. No restaurant despite the websites misleading blurb Very thin walls so very noisy feels like a minimum effort for maximum income

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected from a Eden Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bdbdg G
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the person at de desk wasn't really friendly. At our room, there was a double bed, but hardly big enough for two persons! The room was really small and the bathroom wasn't very clean (hair in the sink and shower). At the bed there was only one large blanket which we had to share. We went to the desk to ask for another one, but that wasn't possible. The bed turned out to be horrible, not even because of the size, but the bedsprings almost came through the matrass. It was hard and it hurt. Since our room was at the backside of the hotel, it wasn't noisy at night, but the hotel itselve is quite noisy. The breakfast was just okay, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugRush
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very very good as it is 10 minutes walk near Leidseplein where all the cafes & bars are and Museumplein where the Rijksmuseum & I Amsterdam sculpture is so you can make silly pics of yourself. Also, with the tram stop so close by you can go anywhere in Amsterdam as well which we did in 5-10 mins. Of course all the theaters are like 5 minutes walk from the hotel. We had a Superior room facing the canals and the room was very clean, it was cleaned everyday and they had real fluffy hotel towels which you don't always get in hotels. The bed was also very good so they have put some though in that. They have a very small elevator so if your traveling light with small bags its convenient. Staff are very nice, friendly people and the breakfast was well worth the money we paid for the room(make sure you book the breakfast in advance on the net as its cheaper). A lot of people complain about the smallness of Amsterdam hotels but you have to remember that the architecture of the city is like that, people live in small, narrow apartments. Also, there are so many things to do in Amsterdam, why would you want to stay in the room so it doesn't matter if it's small. The basic thing in a city hotel is cleanliness, convenience, location, good service, good small eats like breakfast, good housekeeping, good beds and free coffee/tea which this hotel has provided for us. Although we were surprised that the Superior room was more like a Standard Room in Asia(we're half Malaysian so hospitality is well-known to us), the money we spent was well worth it for a long weekend stay.Also, you get free internet in the room and at the cafe downstairs, what more could I ask for? We will stay in this hotel again when we do another weekend trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy during the night, but with a good location”
Reviews.Author: razm
Reviews.Content: In a good location in a part of the center of Amsterdam the hotel offers an excellent opportunity to visit the amazing Amsterdam. Leidse Plein is at 2 minutes far and from there you can start to visit by foot, tram or by boat the city; I recommend by foot because at any corner or on every small canal you have something to see. From the hotel if you like walking on the streets, in about 20 minutes you can reach Westerkerk and from there in 5 min. you are in Dam Square. The hotel rooms have a very basic offer even for a 3 stars hotel. Our room was small, very small with a very tiny double bed. The carpet on the floor wasnâ€™t so clean, with a lot of dirty spots, but the bathroom was acceptable. In fact, the biggest problem with the room is the noise from the street that is very annoying during the night. The breakfast was simple, limited as offer, but enough and everything was clean. The staff is nice and helpful. If itâ€™s possible to do something with the noise from the street during the night the hotel could be a good option, thanks to its good location, to visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “good location,friendly hotel staff,cozy rooms :)”
Reviews.Author: cenkhasdal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the central....Near to cafe's,pub's,vondelpark,shopping n transportation....nice location,very friendly staff...but hotel rooms are small..if it's matter for you think twice....

Reviews.Title: “A good location,”
Reviews.Author: Arturo E
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near Leidseplein, Van Goghs Museum and Rijksmuseum, the Tram to Central Station is less than a five minute walk. The rooms are small but clean and with everything you need. Personal is friendly. Free WiFi is in public areas, but I could connect to it from my room. Cable ethernet is also avalaible at an extra cost. I found check in time a little bit too late (3:00 p.m.).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Hope to be back soo !”
Reviews.Author: didsbox
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in a fantastic spot. Stayed there for two nights, breakfast is a must!!! Staff are very nice and helpful. Free coffee and internet in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - nice beds”
Reviews.Author: Navutu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights (Friday and Saturday). We used our vouchers (oranjepluim) and therefore only had to pay 50,- extra per night. We asked for a twin bed. Since all the economy rooms with twin beds were occupied, we were upgraded free of charge to a standard room (we didn't notice any difference beteween these two type of rooms except of the twin bed offcourse). Positive: - Good central location (close to Leidscheplein) - Sleep quality is good (quiet area and comfortable beds) - At check-in very good service (at check-out very less-experienced staff but still ok service) - very nice shower Negative: - Only thick pillows in the room - Bicycle rent rates are 50% more expensive compared to rental stations on the street - A lot of stains in the carpets in the halls and room

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great staff and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DaneAarhus_Denmark
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in this great hotel. It's 3 min. walk from Leidseplein's restaurants, bars and coffeeshops - exellent. Staff was very friendly and helpful and as a bonus there was complementary coffee and water in the reception. Very very good. Free wifi in lobby as well. Breakfast was plentiful and good tasting. Only small downside was that our room was quite small and warm. But we didn't spend a lot of time there anyway...

Reviews.Title: “Eden Theatre District Hotel â€“ Dirty Carpets, Dirty Carpets, (There is more to this Hotel than that)”
Reviews.Author: MarkWButler5705
Reviews.Content: Having spent 2 nights at the Eden Theatre District Hotel in Amsterdam, I have come to the conclusion that there is much more to this hotel than just dirty carpets, which is what everyone seems to mention in the reviews. When we arrived at the hotel last on Friday afternoon, I asked the extremely helpful Reception staff if it was possible to have a room at the back of the hotel, as I heard that it was quieter at the back. She said no problem and placed myself and my wife on the 3rd floor at the side. The room was fine, the beds were very soft and comfortable and you had all the facilities you could want, including cable TV, hairdryer, and a shower bathroom (no room for a bath really) same in most Amsterdam hotels. The location was perfect, just a 10 minute tram ride from Central Station, on the Number 1 Tram at a cost of 2.60 Euros, and 15 minutes from the Airport, which is directly connected at a cost of 7.60 Euros. So you are there in no time. It is also close to a busy square, (Luijkenstraat) where you get lots of cafes and bars, as well as street jugglers and raps artists as well as really close to the RijksMuseum which is well worth the visit, even just for Rembrandts Night Watch. 12.50 Euros each. We didnâ€™t have the breakfast, or anything to eat there, but they have Free Internet and Tea and Coffee near Reception. The rooms are small, but it is ok at night. We stayed in on the Saturday Night, as the weather was terrible outside. We also travelled to Edam and the Windmills on the Sunday, on a trip, which was about a block away. To sum up, the Eden Theatre District Hotel is perfectly adequate, they do take 50 Euros off you when you arrive, but give it back (minus the taxes) when you leave, so all in all a pleasant stay all down, and Amsterdam is great, this is my third visit. Mark & Michaela

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Place, highly recommend (best value for money)”
Reviews.Author: nemir
Reviews.Content: It was a really clean quit and walking distance to everything, I highly recommend this place, the room was small but that was okay for me as I was by my self

Reviews.Title: “'Perfect as a base, Clean and comfortable'”
Reviews.Author: Jivebunny21
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week in Amsterdam with my Husband and Parents. The Eden Theatre District hotel is clean (apart from the carpets) our towels were changed everyday and the rooms were comfortable. The reception staff were friendly and attentive. The location of the hotel is excellent, we were just minutes walk from the shops, restuarants, coffee shops and more. There are free tea and coffee facilities, free internet use and a vending machine available. My Husband is 6 foot so I was very concerned the rooms would be too small, we asked to see a standard and a superior room and decided the standard room was adequate. All in all a good stay, was just a shame Amsterdam is SO expensive! Trams and bus are the cheapest and most convenient way to travel but if you do book a taxi use 'TCA' they are the cheapest!

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate for the price”
Reviews.Author: missf1017
Reviews.Content: We requested an air conditioned room; upon arrival, were given a choice of 2 rooms, 1 a.c. and 1 without. Room with a.c. was on tippity top floor, stuffy (requiring a.c.), very small. The room without a.c. was 1 level below, felt instantly about 10-15 degrees cooler, had a window & a kickass fan that worked even better than a.c. on the higher floor. It was FAR more spacious, so we took the 1 without a.c. No problems whatsoever. Rooms are clean, very well maintained. As others commented, carpets are riddled with stains throughout the hotel which is peculiar, but seems like nothing more than water stains. Bed was comfortable enough, although the room was on the tinier side of what we're used to as Americans, it was still more than enough in size, bathroom was comfortably spacious. Desk staff very friendly & accommodating, but not very knowledgable about local attractions/activities, so make sure to do your research beforehand about what you want to do and where to go. Overall, a fabulous hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Average place!”
Reviews.Author: emmab016
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located,near the square with a lot of restaurants and places to visit. We did not have to use a taxi as we could walk to the square or use the tram for bigger distances. The hotel's location was very convenient but we found the hotel too expensive for the room that we got.It was very quiet as it was at the back side but it was very small and not much comfortable. The carpet on the floor and some places on the walls seemed very dirty. The breakfast was good but expensive for what it offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ShellyD2323
Reviews.Content: Before leaving for our recent trip to Europe (Amsterdam, Brussels & Paris), this was the hotel my fiance was most worried about quality-wise. But I was pleasantly surprised. It was clean (except for the carpets) and the rooms were tiny, but efficient. Be prepared for the smallest elevator known to man if you have big luggage! The location was amazing - just a few minute walk to the heart of the Leidsplein area. Overall, the hotel was great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor quality”
Reviews.Author: AndreaTrasatti
Reviews.Content: Quality of the room, bed, bathroom and service was at a minimum. Carpet had a few stains, bed was so close to the wall that had only 1 bedside table. Room was ground floor with windows on the street in front of a bus stop. Location was good though, by a canal, 5-10 minutes walk from all the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: j0ndu8
Reviews.Content: If you want something central with a comfy bed, then Eden delivers. Book it, you won't be disappointed. But. In comparison to rivals such as CitizenM for example, the overall attention to detail and experience is left seriously lacking. The rooms are characterless and are in real need of bringing in to the 21st century. Although clean enough, aspects such as the tinged with mould shower curtain don't help, nor do the 'funky' 'fun in the city' photographs and stencils in the hallway distract from what is essentially a tired hotel. Be prepared to pay well for internet and breakfast. Easily forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Biajante
Reviews.Content: -Most positive: Free cofee and tea. Hotel's localization near museums and leidseplein. Good breakfast altought expensive. -Most negative: Extremelly small and noisy rooms, had to change room and still very noise from the other rooms.Very soft bed. Breakfast high price

Reviews.Title: “great stay for a girly weekender”
Reviews.Author: missmistry
Reviews.Content: I have been Amsterdam before and this was my first time staying at a Hotel, so I was really skeptical about to expect but I was pleasantly surprised. We were two young girls on a last minute weekend. This hotel was perfect for a city break especially for a girly weekender! Great location to explore the city; close to restaurants, museums, cafes, shopping and more but also set aside enough for a good nights rest -slept like a baby. Staff were friendly and helpful including Maher who checked us in and gave us a map with directions and Patrick who was happy to let us in when we rolled in at 6 am after a night out. Very safe! Free water, tea and coffee was nice, full length mirror in room, bathroom was clean and hairdryer was a bonus, TV in room was cute and even had a personal welcome message on it! The only down side which I will mention for the skeptics...carpet was a bit stained and the rooms a bit cramped but we didnt spend enough time in the hotel to notice - like i said great stay for a girly weekender.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Ritchie88
Reviews.Content: * Excellent value and location, less than 10 minutes walk from Dam Square & RLD, and a 2 minute walk from Leidseplein with it's excellent little restaurants and bars etc. * The complimentry coffee machine was a nice touch in the lobby in a no frills B&B/hotel. * The Staff's customer service was generally good, however coming in one night we had trouble getting a member of staff to open the night door enterence and he was quite rude when coming to open the door for us. * Our room was located in the basement and by the lift so it was a little noisey and a view from the window was non existent, which may bother some. * Small room, but still comfortable enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but let down by room noise, size and tired feel”
Reviews.Author: alexadams
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Eden, Liedse Square (theatre district) Hotel on a recent trip around Holland. We read the previous reviews and already had a good idea of the sort of accomodation on offer. The location is very central and easily walkable to most places, and on the main tram routes. The room was very small, as was the bathroom. We changed to a twin, just so we didn't feel too claustrophobic. The bedding was clean and the bed comfortable, however the carpet and curtains had several stains which was a bit dissapointing. The price would have been fair if the accomodation was a little less shabby, and stained. Finally there was a lot of noise from the bedrooms eitherside. Especially late at night; calls to reception were needed in order to get the noise stopped. The room (307), and others appear to be divided larger rooms, with thin walls which can be seen from the layout of the windows at the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great beds, great value. Rooms a little shabby.”
Reviews.Author: JobeeToronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value. The location is wonderful. The staff is friendly. The beds are the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept on. Breakfast was included in our room stay and that was nice. The rooms we had on the inside of the hotel were very, very quiet. I think the ones on the outside of the hotel (facing the main road) would not be so quiet. The only criticism is that the rooms were a little shabby. They weren't dirty, the towels and sheets were all clean, but the carpet needed replacing and the bathroom fixtures were old, etc.. Still, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Relatively Cheap and easy to party”
Reviews.Author: russellensley
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed here in Feb 2009 when this was the Eden Amsterdam Centre. The help was great. In fact, i spent my last night staying up all night talking politics with the desk clerk. Great conversation, although my American libertarian streak was in direct confrontation with the Dutch ideas. Room as extremely small (by American Standards) and even small by European standards on the very bottom floor. That posed no problem for me as i was traveling alone and didn't come to Amsterdam to enjoy a hotel room. There was a breakfast buffet, unfortunately i was never able to wake up in time, except for once during the week i was there. This was in easy walking distance to the Leidseplein (everything you need, tons of pubs, coffeeshops, restaurants (including a burger king) and the world's most famous coffeeshop (The Bulldog). Also a short walk to the Van Gogh (pronounced Van (gurgley gh sound) Goh museum. There is a train stop within walking distance so you can be at Centraal station or any of the other places in the canal rings pretty quickly. Cramped quarters, but this is typical in Amsterdam. Clean enough. Better than a hostel, but not a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value”
Reviews.Author: OscarVII
Reviews.Content: We had Room 312, which, to judge from the floor plans, was probably one of the larger double rooms and it was perfectly large enough. Linen and towels were clean and the towels changed daily. The room had its own safe. The staff were excellent - friendly and helpful. We appreciated the always-available tea and coffee (from a machine, but actually quite good) and the two internet-access computers. We didn't have the breakfast, but if you want it, don't book it online; it's cheaper to order it from reception the evening before (â‚¬10.50 as opposed to â‚¬12 - Feb 2011). Reception will sell you public transport "chipkaarts", which are useful for unlimited journeys in a given time period, e.g. 24, 48, 72 hours.) Most of what you will want to see in Amsterdam is however easily walkable from this hotel and the Rijksmuseum and van Gogh museum are both very close, as are many reasonable eating-places. While it is perfectly possible to walk from Amsterdam Centraal Station (allow half an hour), it's probably best to get a No1, 2 or 5 tram from the station from the west end of the front of the station and alight at Leidseplein (indicated by a display in the tram and announced on the tannoy), walk on south past the American Hotel on your right with its fountains to the junction, turn right, continue for about 200 metres, cross the road and the hotel is in front of you. If you decide to walk, find the Damrak and walk south. This wide street becomes the Rokin and shortly after, with a wide canal on your left, the road makes a definite left sweep. Look out for a narrow street called Olieslagersteeg on the right. Turn down it; it does a dog-leg and become the Heiligeweg. Continue to the Leidesplein and find the hotel as per the above.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, quiet comfortable beds, free coffee and tea!”
Reviews.Author: dedwards424
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The staff were very helpful in answering any questions we may have had. The rooms were small, but quiet and clean. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. There was a nice breakfast in the morning. The only bad part was a 3p.m check in, but they did get us a room a little early. Great location if you want to be near all the coffee shops/restaurants and shopping. Highly reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: ekonomista
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location. We came from the airport and we didn't need to ride a cab or shuttle service, we just took a tram and we were already there after 20 minutes. The room is a bit small, but it is big enough for 2 persons. The toilet is generally clean, and heaters work well. Aside from the lack of power for many hours in the night while we were sleeping, it has been a comfortable and lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great facilities - great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jen2Lions
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a three minute walk from the vibe of the Leidse Plein, but that's far enough to avoid the noise and the rabble. We were pleasantly surprised with the room - yes, the bathroom's not enormous, but it was big enough and the shower's powerful; the room was fine, with a clean, comfy double bed, adjustable radiator, socket points, bedside lamps etc. There's a decent bar (although they had run out of white wine) downstairs with a lounge, wifi, a spacous breakfast area and outdoor terrace. They provide news sheets in a few languages each day and there's really good coffee on tap whenever you want it. The staff were friendly, and more than willing to point out local bars, eateries and arrange a 35 euro taxi back to the airport. All in all, for the centre of a major European city, this place offers great value for money and I can't imagine staying anywhere else next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Location, Very Small Room”
Reviews.Author: Jilly2715
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was great. We were here during the winter/ Christmas market. We could walk to everything such as the Anna Frank House, Van Gogh Museum, Red light District, ect. The room was very small and the bathroom was even smaller but overall it was a great place to stay. There was no free internet in your room however, they had 2 computers in the lobby for guests to surf the web for free. The staff was helpful & friendly. I would stay here again when visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, friendly staff and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: emzy_k
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in January 2011 with my boyfriend and another couple. Our room was bigger than the reviews seem to suggest but we were at the end of the corrider. We looked at our friends room and yes they were smaller, but we were there to be out sightseeing all day and think of the hotel as just a place to sleep! The rooms were clean and the staff were very friendly as well. The location was great, just beside leidsplein where there are loads of restaurants and bars. From Leidsplein you could get a tram to central station (which was useful with suitcases!!) but otherwise we just walked to places such as Anne Frank's House, Dam Square etc (about 15 mins walk). There was also free tea, coffee, water and juice at the lobby which was nice! Would stay again for the location and price for a (fairly) central hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ricteix
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam after Xmas for a 4 night break, and were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. To start with, it's in a great location, only a few minutes away on foot to the city centre (not that Amsterdam is that big a city). We stayed in a double bedroom with bathroom, and found it great value for what we paid. The room was, as other reviewers noted, small, but it had everything we needed: a TV, comfortable beds and a clean bathroom. We noticed that the carpets were a bit dirty, but overall the hotel was very clean. The heating was great, which was useful as it was quite cold outside. The hotel staff were extremely helpful everytime we spoke with them, so no complaints here. The free coffee and tea were a great bonus as well, as was free internet in the lobby. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, so cannot comment on it, but it is cheaper if you book when you arrive rather than buying it as part of the package. Overall, this is a great hotel, in a great location, and I would gladly recommend it to everyone if you're visiting Amsterdam for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Marcdb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights . the location is good for trams to central station. Oposite the hotel are shops and 5 mins walk away a very good winter market. Coffee shops for smokers can be found close as well... The hotel is modern and clean, the heating is excellent, the rooms have all modern facilities. internet, tv, etc.... Generally a nice hotel in the city centre... I will use again if required

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: lubox
Reviews.Content: Well, i stayed one night. Rooms are extremly small, but clean. Hotel is in good location, everything in the citycenter is few minutes by walk.

Reviews.Title: “very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sonalibala
Reviews.Content: eden...its not in city centre..its littel far from main stataion..rooms are too small for 2 people...very unsatisfactory ...no space for keep luggag....

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here unless you want to be robbed or treated with disrespect!”
Reviews.Author: LEXI001
Reviews.Content: My nintendo DS was stolen from my room, it was the only piece of equipment worth money left in our room as we took all our money, passports, phones and iPods with us as we never do trust hotels to leave items like these. This was left in the room on charge one day and we discovered it was gone the day of departure . The staff were not helpfull management told us no-one had been in our room according to their card system which did not work on 3 separate occasions locking us out of our own room!?? Resulting in us having to report this as reception and complain that we cannot gain acess to our room with the card they had provided. We did not receive any compensation we were told to fill out a Dutch police form on there wifi computer and that was it. I was shocked that we were then asked to pay for a 4euro film we purchased and breakfast the morning we left after everything we had went through. It is a complete joke and appalling the way this ordeal was handled with. This hotel is not safe please do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanaC22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in October and i have to say it was great. The room was clean and pretty large by amsterdam standards. I found it difficult to find a hotel with a twin room in amsterdam, but this one was great! The location is great, only being a couple of minutes walk from the tram line, and a stone's throw from the leidse square which has many restaurants, and not too far from the attractions including most of the museums. The hotel staff were very helpful and gave us great directions and advice for how to get around... The hotel also had free tea and coffee in the lobby, which was an added bonus. Would definately stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheNewMrsAW
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel - its in a perfect location and for the price, it was much better than we expected. The rooms are small but its in the City Centre, so didn't expect them to be any bigger. The breakfast which was included in the price of the room was well above average, and there was much more choice than you would usually get with a continental breakfast. Lovely hotel staff, and the bar is perfect to have a couple a couple of drinks before heading out in to Amsterdam. Free tea and coffee al day as well which was great! We are booking to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: viccij
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean, small room, mostly quiet at rear of hotel apart from noisy group of teenagers staying. positives- free tea and coffee, clean room and location. negatives- expensive Â£82 per night with no breakfast. Small room, staff polite but not friendly. Steep stairs to access and minute lift. On a personal note be careful of the automatic glass entrance door. On one occasion it did not open resulting in me seriously banging my head and knee. Staff did not even have courtesy of asking if I was alright, as embarrassed did not wish to make a scene but have experienced terrible bruising and discomfort. Would try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but nothing extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: RachaelBee
Reviews.Content: It was in a good location, I'm happy to walk around cities and find my own way around but if for whatever reason you don't want to or can't walk too far it's situated near leidseplein which has plenty of tram to take you round the city centre. Plus points: 1. The staff were very friendly and could not have been more helpful, generally seemed like lovely pleasant people. 2. Location 3. There was no street noise 4. The rooms were clean and not as small as other reviewers have made them out to be unless we just got lucky. Negatives: 1. The toilet was weird! I didn't like it! 2. The doors didn't block out noise from the corridor to well, Amsterdam has a good nightlife scene so when people were coming back in the early hours of the morning we were woken up. The other guests weren't particularly noisy, the sound just seemed to carry. 3. The "temperature control" in the room was a fan,job but to be fair it did the. 4. Even though it was a none smoking hotel the room did smell like old smoke and needed airing when we got in. 5. I would advise women especially to take shampoo and conditioner with them as the stuff they had was awful and turned my hair to straw. If you rent a bike through the hotel get there early they were all out when we tried to! They did direct us to another place but we couldn't find it ANYWHERE (more our failing than the hotels). All in all it was a good hotel, none of the negatives were something we couldn't over come and I would stay there again. It isn't 5* luxury but it isn't cheap and tatty either, just an average hotel for a weekend away!

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Monica987
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there for our spring holiday. We loved the hotel! the location was great, good value for money and nice staff- for sure we will go back! We also want to point out that the booking website where we made our reservation- www.easytobook.com was super easy! the site is user friendly, we didn't have any problem with the payment and we were able to also check on the site what kind of attractions are near by- very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: jbbb_83
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small. Close to city centre and Metro system. About a 30 min walk to red light district but you can catch the train there. Also very close to Canal hop on/hop off boat. Friendly english speaking staff. Computers in Lobby with free internet access. Value for money

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Flavio1
Reviews.Content: It is ok. Clean and central. Overpriced though, it is not worth all that money - and breakfast was not even included! For that rate I have been to 5 star hotels (and I am talking about very expensive countries like Sweden), seriously. It would be perfect if it was cheaper. I must praise the staff though, always nice, efficient and at your fingertips!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Kwiptix
Reviews.Content: This is one of those hotels which clearly does the absolute minimum to scrape through the qualification for 3*. The room is the smallest I've ever seen in a hotel room outside of Japan. The carpet seems never to have been cleaned since it was installed and has long forgetten its original colour. Amenities are at a minimum, no fridge, no drinking glasses just some flimsy airline plastic cups, only one full size towel per room. The location is fairly convenient though, close to (but not on ) Leidseplein so very easy to reach from any part of town or by direct bus from the airport. Overall though, not to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Bit like a Ditch Travel Lodge.....no frills here!”
Reviews.Author: KingswinfordSteph
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night whilst stranded due to volcano! were sent here by another Eden Hotel as they were fully booked. Very plain and sparse.....bit like a cross between a travel lodge and a school residential! Good for price...suppose you get what you pay for. However the next night we moved to the Eden Lancaster - cheaper still but 10 x better!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MizzLilyy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a friend for six nights and it was amazing! We had a room with a nice view with the canals. There was a problem prior to our arrival but the management was accommodating and very helpful and it was fixed. This hotel was a great location you could walk to all the attractions in around Amsterdam! The staff was very friendly and kind. The room was clean and comfortable. If i could EVER go back i would stay at this hotel again no doubt. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Cannabis Cup 2009 Amsterdam, NL”
Reviews.Author: MetalHeadLurch
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, centrally located near the entertainment district. and the concert hall De Melkig which holds all concerts for the cup and judging. Just make sure that if you buy anything there that you give yourself enough time to mail it through the post office. However, whatever you do, do not and I mean do not send anything through the hotel unless your a millionaire and don't mind spending a crap load of money to mail it FedEx.

Reviews.Title: “valued for money!”
Reviews.Author: Jessie_car
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights so far, checking out tomorrow morning.. first time traveling alone.. and safely is my utmost concern.. this hotel managed to give me the sense of security i needed.. there is a camera right at the front door to monitor who enters in.. the front door is locked during the early morning.. but there is a receptionist who will gladly unlock it for u.. a keycard is needed to go beyond the lobby.. the room is clean and sufficient for 1 person.. however the pillow is not comfortable.. but i was lazy to get them to change.. haha! the bathroom is kinda small but it is still decent.. the location is good.. it it near leidseplein but not too near so the noise doesnt reach the hotel.. there is also free wifi, coffee and tea in the hotel lobby, and 2 other computers for you to use... i booked the hotel rather early so i got a gd deal of an average of 39 euros a night.. it is definitely valued for money!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, Great location”
Reviews.Author: DebNJohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in early March. We had room 425, top floor with a nice window view out the front of the hotel. The room was clean, modern and roomy. Other reviews have mentioned the tiny spaces, but our room was more than big enough with a bath shower combination, plenty of luggage space, and a large enough space to actually move around in. Service was efficient, our room was cleaned daily and to a high standard, sheets and towels changed everyday. The hotel offers free coffee, pretty bad coffee, but it was free and was nice to have a cup before starting out in the morning. We did not opt for the breakfast at 10Euros prebooked and when we saw what was on offer we were glad we didn't, mainly cereal, some fruit and cold cuts and some muffins, NOT worth 10 euros. The best part of this hotel is the location, two minutes from the Leidesplein and trams which will take you everywhere. In walking distance to most attractions, or right around the corner form tram stops if you don't want to walk. We would stay here again. We got it as part of a package deal so the three nights cost us about 200 euros, for the location, the cleanliness, and the overall experience definiltey worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, small rum, overpriced breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Andreas2524
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean, small room, cold bathroom. Free tea and coffee which is awesome. I have met friendlier, nicer staff somewhere else. I didn't eat breakfast at the hotel because I thought it was a bit too overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “shame about the lack of wheelchair accessability...”
Reviews.Author: little_one4483
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i chose this hotel for it's location and because it boasts a wheelchair friendly room and a lift (my boyfriend is wheelchairbound). When we arrived however we saw that the main entrance is the scariest most narrow and high stepped staircase! I asked right away if there is another entrance to the hotel, but the answer was no. Tell me something... WHAT IS THE POINT OF A WHEELCHAIR FRIENDLY ROOM IF THE ENTRANCE TO THE HOTEL IS COMEPLETELY IMPOSSIBLE FOR SOMEONE IN WHEELCHAIR!?! In all other aspects the hotel was fine, and the staff helped me to get my boyfriend up and down the stairs each time. but i would not choose the hotel again because of the accessability problem. I also found the price quite high for the quality, as the beds were not very good and that is the main point of a hotel in my opinion (being able to get a good nights sleep).

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Wolfhound86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect, if your not too fussy. The good thing about this hotel is the location. It is just across the road from leidseplein area, which lots of busy bars, etc. Also the hotel is a 5 min walk from Vondelpark, 10 mins walk to Van Gogh Museum. From leidseplein to centraal station you can take the trams no. 1,2 & 5. Also tram no. 10 takes you to Brouwerij lj windmill brewery (a must if you like beer!!) The room it "cosy" but clean, and would suit people who travel light or are ok living out of a suitcase. It can get a bit noisy at times , but if your in Amsterdam you won't be spend much time in your room! Staff are friendly, not sure what the breakfast was like, it seemed a bit expensive 15 Euro for cont breakfast. There is a nice little supermarket around the corner, which sell lovely breads, fruits, cheeses, meats, etc. So we had breakfast 'al fresco' in vondelpark every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in the centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DeeALondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location close to amenities and centre of Amsterdam. I could walk everywhere without the worry of taxis and trams! I agree the hotel stairs are ridiculously steep but there are a few places in Amsterdam with that common theme! This hotel is fine for those who are not after absloute luxury and just want a decent hotel to explore Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Lovely Location, made the trip to Amsterdam GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: Froggie23
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel to a very warm, professional welcome. We were a little early so were offered a secured room to leave our luggage. When checking in a little later, the room was clean, looked comfortable and was nice, besides it being a little small but this did not bother me and my partner as it was rather cosy :o) We were a little way out but it was a lovely walk in (around 15 minutes to Dam Square)through shops and canals, trams ran litterally every minute to Dam square and there are plently of lovely pubs and restaurants to stop at on the way & don't forget the bakeries they are so lush you just want to eat everything! We hired bikes for one day from Mikes Bikes (which was the cheapest, near the hotel), they were so fantastic we had them for the duration we were there! The hotel was a great location and I thoughly enjoyed my stay there! They provided an excellent service and I always felt I could ask them for anything and they would help! Not that I really needed to as they provided everything that was needed. Hope this helps with your decision to book with the hotel, we certainly will be booking it next time we go!

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP BUDGET HOTEL, RUDE STAFF, YET HIGH PRICE”
Reviews.Author: neofytos
Reviews.Content: Was booked by the company for me. I walked in and initially thought its not too bad as its a budget hotel. VERY steep stairs with tiny steps, tiny lift. I had a double room, which was the size of a standard single in other hotel. The place was a bit dusty although not unclean. The bed was terrible, I sunk through the middle of it and had springs pointing into my back, the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything going on in the hotel. The entire hotel seems to slant, as you walk you seem to tip forward, I put the key card on the desk and it slid off!.The bathroom was ok but budget style, however there was no hot water and the shower handle wouldnt stay on the fitting properly. When I told the receptionist about the lack of hot water in my room, she said quite abruptly "no, there is hot water", WHAT? To tell the truth, I just thought were were checked into a really budget place and wasnt holding it against the hotel, apart from the rude staff and cold water as cheap hotels often have a bed fit for the dustbin. I checked out early and the staff did not like it at all. They were very rude in dealing with the cancelation and charged the final night. Its when I checked out and found out the price, I WAS STUNNED!!!!! I have stayed in many budget hotel better than this costing 50-70 Euros. This place is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very good location, great price.”
Reviews.Author: FrugalFly
Reviews.Content: Good safe location a few minutes walk from Leidsplein Center. Friendly staff and clean hotel, with a good sized room for 2 people, good bathroom with toiletries. Beds were okay, but pillows were square and non-supportive. In-room safe, good AC, heating, desk, 220V outlets, flat screen TV with ~20 channels, mostly Dutch. Free wifi in lobby, but not in room. Elevator is a European closet conversion, and the stairs are steep, so this hotel is not for physically challenged. Breakfast is offered at EU$10, good price for Amsterdam, but we didn't try it. Overall, good deal in Amsterdam for the price -- under EU$100 in July from Hotels.com

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: xCharlottex1
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is away from the hustle and bustle of the downtown area but easily available by a short tram ride. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We prebooked breakfast each day and thought it was good. Like most hotels there the rooms are small but sufficient for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel in the very center of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jhndel
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy are stay in the 5th floor in room with view over the city. Nice and cossy room recently renovated with nice and simply decoration. Nice glass wall bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: thisgirlnamedsam
Reviews.Content: Most of these reviews are right on, I just wanted to point out that the hotel is in an amazing location in Amsterdam! We walked to almost everything we did, and the trains once you figure them out are really easy! The hotel was clean, the room was well kept, they changed out our twels each day which was nice. We didn't eat breakfast here. For the price it is a really great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jerseywonder_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice this year now (2009). Rooms are very clean, if somewhat small, but all have a T.V. with free to watch BBC, and news channels. Also pay per veiw moovie and adult channels if your so inclined. A nice feature in rooms is a free safe that you programme with your own code. As mentioned by others, drinks and breakfast is expensive, but Leidseplein Squre is just a few minutes away where there are bars, restuarants, a nightclub (free entance), a sports bar for footie fans where a pint is 3.90 euros as opposed to 5 or 6 elsewhere and a Bulldog coffee shop for smokers. Easy to get to from the Airport. Take the train from the Airport to Amsterdam Central Station, from there get a number 1, 2 or 5 tram to Leidseplein Square (takes about 15 minutes). At the square walk in the direction the tram is going accross the canal (By the canal there is a tourist info kiosk on your right shoulder.) At the main road, turn right and walk about 300 Metres to a set of pedestrian lights and across the road is the Hotel. To get the best rates, shop around! I tried the Eden Hotel Group website, the hotels own website and I even phoned the hotel direct, but the best rate was from a booking agent on this site - about 30% cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: rajgupta
Reviews.Content: Checked in OK, but the room was small and not clean. Carpets were rough and dirty. Make sure you wear slippers when walking on the carpet. Bed was good. But the biggest problem was the noise comming from the neighboring door and it woke me up number of times in the night. Breakfast is just 2 crossiants and a coffee. You stand in a line behind what is normally a bar and they will give you a plate with the two crossiants. that is it. Not worth more then $75 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: AME123
Reviews.Content: This is a central hotel that is reasonably priced. The rooms are very clean, we stayed four night and they were cleaned each day. The staff are friendly and helpful, and they booked restaurants and taxis for us and gave general information. We had a lovely meal at an Italian called Vasso on Rozenboomsteeg. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel so couldn't comment. On the down side, we had a standard room and it was small, maybe the superior rooms are bigger but there were none available when we tried to upgrade. We were on the first floor at the back so there was no view. The doors are very thin and if there are noisy people staying on your floor then you will definitely hear them coming and going. Overall, it is a basic hotel that is clean, central and reasonable so it is a good base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Clean And friendly”
Reviews.Author: adamparsfan
Reviews.Content: Good hotel to go to, 2 mins away from leidsplein, and the museum district, clean and modern with friendly staff, room was also very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller81
Reviews.Content: Good points * Good location * Free internet * Good size, clean rooms * Safe * Helpful staff - we were first issued a room which absolutely stank of cigarattes. They moved us without a fuss (although our new room no longer had canal views). * Bar in lobby * 5 mins to train station on tram #1 which stops out the front. Bad Points * They charhe 15 euro for breakfast so we didn't bother

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!! Nice, clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Summertime-FL
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean & modern, very close to Leidseplein which was nice! It's with in walking distance to museum square, vondlepark & the redlight district. The best way to see the city is to WALK! The trams were very close to the hotel too. Hotel was VERY easy to get to from the airport by using the train to central staion & then the tram. We stayed in room 409 which was on the top floor. The room was more spacious than some of the other places I have stayed in Europe. Room also had a nice view of the city. Would recommend getting this room if possible! Hotel had computers in the lobby with free internet which was really nice! Bathroom was a tad small, and had a paper thin shower curtain so after your shower the floor was pretty wet. (my only complaint ) Staff cleaned our room every day (we stayed for 5 nights) and overall we enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would stay here again next time we visit this beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mayoleine
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed in the Eden Amsterdam Centre Hotel in july. We loved this hotel! The location is just perfect. I is right in the middle of the city centre. The staff was very helpful with finding a nice restauant. The room was small, but very modern. We had a room with a nice view on the canals. We came to the hotel by car, and we were very suprised that there was a carparking! I would realy recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “great location, free internet”
Reviews.Author: phchao
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Leidseplein hotel for 5 nights for work and while it was a small room, it was efficiently organized. It was also very clean and the decor was above the regular Marriott drab. We even had a view of the canal! While it is very close to Leidsepein for easy transportation options, it is very close to the Negen Straatjes (9 streets) shopping area with boutiques, as well as Museumplein. Even better, it is quite and not far from the residential areas where you can go to a supermarket or street markets to pick up fruits and bottled water. The one thing that was tricky was the breakfast. When we checked in, the front desk informed us of the times that buffet breakfast was served so we thought it was included. However, when we check out, they said our prepaid online price did not include breakfast and it was 15 euros per person per day! If we had known it was not included, we would never have had that breakfast. (it was good quality, but for 15 euros, I'd like some caviar omelet!) As for the free internet, there is no free wireless, but there are 2 computers in the lobby with free access, and usually there is no line.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on Leidsplein Square!”
Reviews.Author: hurleygirl024
Reviews.Content: Great value for price paid. The room, although quite small, was still comfortable and very tastefully decorated. We even had a view of a Canal! Shower was a bit odd, as it had no side walls just a curtain, so we got water all over the floor, just ask for extra towels in advance! The Location was the best, just down the street from Van Gogh, Rijksmuseum, Anne Frank, and Leidsplein Square. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, they ensured we were up for our early train ride at 5 am and made sure a cab was waiting to take us to the station. If you are looking for a nice hotel with easy access to all the sites this is the place to stay. Although we did not eat at the hotel, there were many restaurants in walking distance as well. Another bonus was the free Internet access in the Lobby. *Also If you are taking a taxi anywhere and they do not recognize the name of the hotel - say you are at the Tulip Inn as they recently changed the name and some taxi cabs don't realize this.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: RetiredBears
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked not by our choice, but by a travel agent as part of their group tour package. If you are 50+, or with any physical limitations, do not consider this hotel. To enter the hotel, you must climb ~ 1/2 a flight of steep stairs. We were a group (~30) of older travelers (all 60+) and had to carry our own suitcases to the lobby - the staff offered no assistance and only watched. The lobby is tiny, barely accommodating the people, let alone their luggage. No assistance was provided to get suitcases to the room - which took a while as the elevator barely fit 2 suitcases and a person. The room we were assigned was miniscule. To avoid bumping into the wall when getting out of bed, you had to scoot to the end of the bed, and then be careful not to trip over your suitcase as there was no place to put them except on the floor. They were ill prepared to handle a larger group of people coming in for breakfast running out of silverware and food and not seeming to care (another steep set of stairs to get to the breakfast room). Others in our group indicated they had a larger room and said it was ok. The saving grace for us was that it was at least located ~.3 miles to a tram that you can take to the center of Amsterdam. We would not consider this hotel to be in the center of Amsterdam, but the outer fringe of the centrum. The hotel was relatively clean, but the decor was tired. The bathroom was in good condition, but had a half step to enter and many stubbed their toes! Watch out though - the shower curtain was too short so you can easily create a "flood" when showering! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: augustLeeds
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a room only basis with my partner. Our first impressions were that the outside of the hotel, the reception area, the bar area and the room itself were all clean, smart and well decorated. Yes, the bar area was abit smoky ( only because someone was smoking in there!) and yes the room was quite small but this is Amsterdam afterall! We had a first floor room and despite being warned about ongoing refubishments, we didnt hear/see any work going on during our 3 night stay. The room was modern, had a lcd tv with cable channels movies, a decent sized bathroom & shower & was nice & cosy considering it was freezing outside! The traffic on the road outside was quite busy between 4pm-11pm but this is to be expected in any city centre. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the hotel is in the perfect location. To be honest im rather baffled by some of the poor reviews and comments people have made about their awful experiences! Theres so much to do in Amsterdam we only went back to the room to re-charge & sleep & all in all had a fantasic time & would definately go back. N.B the hotel is now called Eden Centre and is now non smoking apart from in the bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: evey05
Reviews.Content: Booked a deluxe double, got a tiny twin room. Building works were ongoing (I wasn't aware of this as we booked through a third party but it does state it on their website) The receptionist was very helpful and pleasant, said we had a quiet room on the first floor - it might have been quiet if not for the workmen in the room above who started work at 6 am. Hotel stank of smoke, especailly the reception was disappointing, I'm not a smoker but my partner is and he found it off putting as well. Maybe when the upgrade is done the hotel might be worth recommending.......

Reviews.Title: “Decent experience”
Reviews.Author: jmgo
Reviews.Content: I thought the rate was high for the very small room that I had booked. The room seemed clean, and we had a window's view of someone's backyard. Although the website says that it's near to Museumplein (it definitely is), it's also close to the Leidesplein tram stop (I believe the 1, 2, 5 stop by there).

Reviews.Title: “Tacky hotel and tacky staff”
Reviews.Author: cwboy
Reviews.Content: Smoky, tiny room, bed slanted head down. We put our bags in the room, went to the desk and told them we had smoke in our room and had requested a non smoking room. Did they have another? The answer was no, yet people continued to check in after us. We went out for dinner down the street and after dinner walked into the NH Hotel and booked another room. We went back to the hotel and upon telling them we were checking out they informed us that there were better rooms available. When I asked the girl at the front why she didn't change the room at the beginning she said the room just came up. Needless to say we still checked out and had a great last night in Amsterdam after 30 days of travel. The hotel still charged us for the night even though we had not used the room. Tacky hotel and tacky staff. Date of our stay was October 4, 2007

Reviews.Title: “great hotel unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: humanaffliction
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the tulip inn we were informed of a mistake that had been made, although we had been told it would not be a problem. By not having the card used to make payment we were initially made stranded until we had to get a fax sent through verifying the card was not stolen. this was a major problem on our trip and got it off to a bad start. the staff where at either end of the spectrum some were highly helpful yet one in particular was ignorant and didn't care and made it extremely clear this was not her problem. Other than this the room was small but very clean and of nice decor, the shower was like a kettle and burned me on several occasions. the location is superb and it is near tig barra which is a lovely lively venue. i would stay in the hotel again but the one thing that was a problem was an unhelpful member of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: PCAdventure
Reviews.Content: Clean, neat and everyone was very efficient and helpful. This was our first stop of a several country tour, we did not speak the language and we had flown through the night, navigated the train and tram and landed here. So, their excellent English and desire to accomodate was great. They were helpful with directions, cabs, etc. Room was small, yes, but neat and clean and linens were really good. A little crowded for a week long stay but great for a night or two. Internet stations were great to keep in contact with everyone. Small bar and sitting area were nice for a bit of elbow room when you needed it. Amsterdam is so beautiful and there is so much to explore, nobody should stay in their hotel room for anything more than sleeping anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: ShailaC
Reviews.Content: Given the size of European hotels & the general level of customer service in Amsterdam this place was not bad. Customer service was adequate and the room was neat & clean. Furnishings were new & modern. The price was right for me: 120 USD or less per night. Great location: close to the Leidseplein & Rijksmuseum and away from the tacky / seedy Red Light and Central Station areas. That said, everything in Amsterdam is walking distance. Did have a little bit of a mosquito problem, but that is to be expected any where with all those canals and no AC (necessitating open windows).

Reviews.Title: “Tulip inn centre”
Reviews.Author: ilesal
Reviews.Content: I have now been to Amsterdam 5 times over the last 5 years, this was one of the best hotels I have stayed in yet. The hotel is just 2 mins walk from leidseplein. Yes the rooms are cosy, not what Americans will be comfortable with, (but everything in Amsterdam is narrow and tall.) The room was modern, very clean, you get a tv with movie access, safe, telephone, internet access. The security is very good as you have to use your door card to access the lifts and stairs and if you only plan to use the hotel to sleep and get ready to go out this is a perfect location. The hotel has a cheap bar, free internet access. After you check out, by 11am, you can then store your bags. Remember city tax charge will apply on top of your hotel bill! This caught us out.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: fivetimesbaby
Reviews.Content: Hi, Just returned after 4 nights at this great hotel.As others have said the rooms are pretty small,but everything you need from a City hotel.Easy check in with polite staff,very clean rooms with a great power shower. Its all about location with this hotel,couple of minutes walk to Liedersplein with its numerous bars and countless restaurants.From here you can catch a tram that passes a number of attractions including the Flower Market (only a short walk to Rembrandtsplein) and Dam Square. When we go back we will look no further than this hotel,but i must say it would really benefit from air conditioning !

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: misskoka
Reviews.Content: The Tulip Inn Hotel was an excellent place to stay! Our room was compact, well designed, immaculately clean, and quiet. We were pleasantly surprised by the hotels convenience, and accessibilty. Though our room was compact, it was well designed and thought out. Everything had its place! The staff were helpful and friendly, more than willing to help us when we needed assistance navigating the transit system and finding different locations within the city. The Tulip Inn is perfectly situated in the centre of the city, within walking distance to dozens of restaurants, bars, museums, and shopping! The hotel also provides free internet access in the main lobby. If you are looking for a great place to stay in the heart of the city, this is an amazing hotel! Highly reccommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: aberdeen1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, the hotel is in a brilliant location, restaurants, bars etc just around the corner in leidseplein. hotel room was very clean and our room was cleaned every day. The bathroom was very small but thats my only complaint, we had a fab time in amsterdam and would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Blah”
Reviews.Author: spacemonkeymafia
Reviews.Content: This place was NOT GOOD. I am normally very easy to please when it comes to hotels, but the staff at this place was seriously clueless. It took them forever to find our reservation and get us a room (to the point where we were worried we'd be turned away!). The room we finally got was TINY. Again, I'm from NY and do not expect much in terms of space! But this was shockingly small. Whatever, it was clean and we only stayed for one night. But I would definitely NOT recommend this place. Good location, though!

Reviews.Title: “All you need for a great stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: jujusug28
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at Schiphol, we took a taxi to the hotel (36 euros) and had a lovely taxi driver who was more than willing to give us some tips on places to visit etc. We arrived at the hotel and checked in, which took around 5 mins to fill in a form and get our key card. We then went to our room which was a small double with a canal view on the 2nd floor. We had read reviews before we went and were fully aware that the rooms could be small, and ours certainly was, but was more than adequate with a double bed, desk, small wardrobe, excellent safe facility, and lovely clean bathroom with a great power shower. There isn't much room in the wardrobe to hang your clothes, only 5 or 6 hangers available but if you're happy to live out of your suitcase for your stay like we were, then you will be fine. There was a great flat screen tv which has british channels BBC World and also BBC1 and BBC2! It also had Discovery and a few other satellite channels. You could also pay for movies, which varied from Adult, to recent Blockbusters and Kids. It also had a Wake up call facility, and you could also check your bill on screen. The room also has free internet access if you decide to bring your laptop, although the hotel does have 2 free internet access PC's in the bar. The bar is small but nice, prices are not too bad for Amsterdam. There is also a vending machine (a bit dearer) which sells juice, coke, heineiken and sweets/pringles, you can use this all through the nite if you wish as the bar closes at 1am. Breakfast is optional at 15 euros which we thought was on the pricey side, so we didn't use it. There is an Irish pub just beside the Holland Casino about 300m away which does a very hearty full Irish brekkie for 10 euros! There are also plenty of eateries in the Leidse square just a minutes walk away. Leidse square and the Leidesplein itself is your nearest place for restaurants, snacks and loads of shops, and coffeeshops! Italian, Pizzerias, Chinese, Indian, McDonalds, Pancakes, Patisseries, fast food places, the choice is immense! We went to Saturnino's Italian which was lovely, cosy but a bit noisy, but worth it for the lovely carbonara and the Panna Cotta desert! We ate out every nite in different restaurants and roughly you will pay around 20 euros each for a decent 2 course with wine. The hotel is in a great location, in a really nice area. A 5 min walk to the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh. The vondel park is the same. You can walk to the Dam Square/Central Station area in about 30 mins. We didn't need to take the tram or bus because everywhere you would want to go is walkable. I would definately stay in this hotel again for the location. The rooms were small but more than adequate, the hotel services are fine and for the price (115 euros a night) I think it's very reasonable as some Amsterdam hotels can be very pricey in this area. We had great service, the room was cleaned daily and towels replaced daily. The reception were happy to call us a taxi for our journey home too. All in all we had a great time in Amsterdam and the hotel didn't disappoint in any way, I'd be more than happy to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to the restaurants”
Reviews.Author: MaryLou28
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms (one for me and my husband) and the other for my parents. Both were double rooms within the same price bracket, however one room was considerably larger than the other. Great tidy rooms, which looked like they were recently refurbished. Flat screen TV on the wall, and air con. Quiet room, conveniently located near the restaurant area of Amsterdam centre. Only negative was the breakfast. At 15 Euro each it was very expensive and you didn't get much for what you paid for. We would definitely recommend eating elsewhere. Rececption provided a map of Amsterdam upon arrival and we were able to leave our bags until our room was available later in the day. We were pleasantly surprised by the hotel, as it was one of the cheaper hotels closer to the centre that we were able to find.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: Tanja L
Reviews.Content: I was never given a confirmation of my reservation with this hotel. When I called the hotel to confirm my reservation, I was told I had none. I was charged for a no-show anyways. Then when I wrote to the hotel about the matter, I was denied a refund. It is truly shocking that a large hotel chain would treat its guests in such an appalling and careless manner.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: my_screen_name_LA
Reviews.Content: A very disappointing experience! We were forced to pay for a room that we could not use. The receptionist was not apologetic about the situation and basically said it was our problem. Hereâ€™s what happened: My colleague in Germany made the reservation, prepaid, for a double room for my cousin and me. Upon arrival, the receptionist hastily handed the check in form for us to fill out and moved on to help another customer. She was still helping the other customer when we completed our form, so another receptionist helped us with the check in. He took the long time, about 15 minutes, checking us in. We were handed our room key, so off we went. When we opened the door, the room turned out to be single room.
