Thinking that they simply made a mistake, we went back downstairs to get the room situation straightened out. We spoke to the original receptionist. She simply said they had more single rooms than doubles, and they were out of double rooms. We asked her to refer us to another hotel. Fine, she said, but we would still need to pay for the room that we could not use. It was our choice to stay or go. 15 minutes of pointing out that it was their problem that they could not accommodate us went nowhere. We finally just asked her to refer us to another hotel and we left.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but small room. Staff was mixed quality. Ok value, not great.”
Reviews.Author: chrisco333
Reviews.Content: Great location (across canal from Leidseplein) with easy access to museums, canal tours, street cars, etc. Hotel was nice and our room was quiet. Breakfast not included in price. All of the staff was nice except for one guy, who should not at all be in a "customer facing" position. We also witnessed a person trying to clear up a reservation mistake (they had booked a room with a certain bed configuration but got something different and were requesting it be corrected). How the clerk handled that mix-up was kind of amazing too. The customer appeared to have his reservation receipt showing what he was supposed to get, but it didn't matter. She basically told the guy "too bad" and did not offer anything. Back to the hotel itself and the value for the money: It seemed a little expensive for what you got, but then again I do not know the Amsterdam hotel market.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Mini Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SwindonEggnog
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Tulip Inn for 3 nights on a mini-break. Excellent location to explore Amsterdam and close to some cosy restaurants, if you look beyond the neon signs. Only a 15 minute stroll to Dam Square via the main shopping streets. The reception area and lounge/bar were clean and bright and the staff friendly and helpful. Free internet access and a selection of magazines and newspapers to browse in the lounge area were a bonus. The room itself was compact but the decor was modern and the room was very clean and bright. No bath but a powerful shower. The room was cleaned every day. In my opinion, this hotel provided fantastic value for money and I would definitiely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: BristolFER
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in early January. The hotel was in a great location - tram stops nearby as well as bars and restaurants etc. It gave good value for money ( we got low rates through expedia), a lot cheaper than staying right in the centre. The staff were friendly and the hotel tidy. Didn't try their breakfast but had some drinks in the bar each night which seemed to stay open until quite late. Our room was small but clean as was the bathroom,so neither caused any problems. We would be happy to stay here again and recommend it for a break in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: hurst21uk
Reviews.Content: Although the room was a bit cramped, it was nicely set out and clean. The hotel staff were very friendly and overall i enjoyed my stay in the hotel. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk away from the Damrack but there are enough restaurants, shops and bars within a minutes walk, that you do not feel out of the way. A great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but nice!”
Reviews.Author: lainey8873
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel but very clean and tidy!! I didn't think the staff were that friendly to be honest and they weren't very helpful at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: artois1974
Reviews.Content: Having read a few dodgy reviews I was unsure what to expect. Upon arrival I found a very pleasant hotel in an excellent location. The staff were very friendly and the accomodation was how I expected. Yes, the rooms were not the biggest but there was ample room to change, sleep etc and they came equipped with an easy to use safe. The hotel was very clean and the free internet in lobby was very handy. I would recommed the hotel and definitley stay there again. People who expect greater things should really look to be staying in the Marriot next door and paying well over the 70 euros a night we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nonsta
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews of this hotel I was apprehensive about what was facing me. When we arrived at the hotel we were impressed by the reception area and the prompt and friendly service we were given. The only access to the upstairs is by key card in the lift or the door to the stairs so we felt very secure. When we entered the bedroom it was a perfect size for two, flat screen tv and very comfy beds after trekking around Amsterdam. I would recommend ths hotel to my friends and family. It is slightly out of the centre but the walk to Dam Square is nice and you can experience most sides of the city. I would recommend a map as it can be very confusing especially at night. The only down side was that the shower was very powerful but the shower tray and curtain weren't adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bainsworth
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, Very friendly and helpful staff. Pretty good location and good value.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel to visit”
Reviews.Author: porschej
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from our stay at the Tulip Inn. The hotel has a cute slogan,"Where the Stars Meet" and they literally mean what they say... The building contains two hotels, one Tulip Inn three star hotel and the second the Golden Tulip four star hotel. The rooms at the Tulip Inn were clean and offered all of the aminities we needed for our stay. The hotel is far enough from downtown to offer a relaxing stay, yet close in proximity by taking the #22 or #48 bus. Be careful when traveling after 12:30a.m. because you have to take another bus, "the night bus". Make sure you ask where the stop is located. We traveled one night on the night bus expecting the bus to drop us off in front of the hotel as the day busses do; however, the stop was on the opposide side of the street... We were unaware the next stop was about two miles down the road and they did not offer any buses going back to the hotel nor did they offer any going back to Central Station... Pretty scarry at 1:00 in the morning! Overall the hotel was a pleasant stay and the staff excellent. One word of caution, be careful with the windows as they can be pushed out and into the room. I received a nasty cut from one of the windows by not realizing it was situatied under my chair...

Reviews.Title: “A Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sashimijazz
Reviews.Content: A great small Hotel - saw some of earlier negative reviews - but my stay was a pleasure. Very reasonable rate, clean room and more than adequate toilet and bath amenities, well-maintained, and very helpful and friendly staff - with free internet facilities. Would definitely stay again. (Perth, Australia)

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and one tiny tiny bathroom with paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: mooresf
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally located. But Amsterdam is so small, you can walk or bike to any where in the city in about 10-20 minutes. The rooms were extremely bare and small. We stayed on the top floor, yet we could hear people walking/talking on our floor and the one below. The walls are paper thin!! We could hear the people in the next room lifting the toliet seat!!! The bathroom was also extremely tiny with a shower that was about 2 feet by 2 feet. When we took a shower the entire bathroom got wet. Also, no air conditioning. We stayed there 3 long nights and slept with ear plugs all 3 nights. It felt more like a hostel-not like a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Montreal_CanadaLizzy
Reviews.Content: Don't know if it changed much since last summer, but, I had a great & relaxing stay at this hotel! It was walking distance to all the top tourist sites and tram services. They offered free wireless internet in a comfortable lounge area & their rooms were modern & secure. Their breakfast was pricy but their room rates were affordable if you booked in advance & online of course. The hotel desk staff were friendly & helpful. I'd consider staying there again! I noticed some comments on this site regarding a wallet or luggage being stolen - welcome to Amsterdam! Perhaps you missed the videos playing on trams showing how pick-pockets can steal your personal belongings? Hope you had insurance coverage!

Reviews.Title: “At the same level as a youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: Happyhubby&Daddy
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Amsterdam at the Marriott for the last 5 years...the hotel is uninspiring but you know what you are getting. When I went to book this trip, it was 290 Euros/night. I tried the Tulip Inn Amsterdam Center, and was immediately disaapointed once I opened my door. The room is just too small! The window(no a/c) overlooked a dirty little alley. Whenever I came off the lift, I smelled the same perculiar smell...vomit mixed with hazzlenuts. The carperts are dirty but the rest of the rooms are pretty clean. The only saving grace about this hotel is the free wi-fi in the bar and the day staff..The one gentleman working in the evening only can say "no, we are fully booked". Do stay here if you are newly graduated from college, an feel as if your dorm room was too big for your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Poor choice!”
Reviews.Author: RandT
Reviews.Content: Very disapointing, expensive to get to from Central Station (17 Euro), access is difficult for luggage, as the room elevators are accessed by walking through the restaurant and lounge. They charge high rates for the wireless internet and the breakfast. The room was cold and the bed uncomfortable, certainly nothing to brag about...but worst of all, the carpet in the room and the hallways was filthy. Don't believe the frequent flier promotions they offer, you only get points if you pay "rack rate". Not Recomended!

Reviews.Title: “super stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First trip for me to Amsterdam, my Husband took me for my 40th,birthday . Hotel spotlessly clean ,friendly reception,very helpful .About a 20 minute walk into Dam Square ,tram stop near bye,would recommend a stay at this very well run hotel.THANKYOU from Birkenhead England.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: dont stay here unless you want to get ur money stolen from the hotel. i left my luggage in their secure luggage room, to find my money had been nicked!i realised when i was at the airport so it was too late to go back. dont stay here guys!i am very dissapointed and annoyed and it ruined a cool few days in the dam!

HotelInfo.Name: Hampshire Hotel - Theatre District Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Nassaukade 387 - 390, Amsterdam 1054AE, The Netherlands
